intro: Podachaenium skutchii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Podachaenium skutchii is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to survive in low-nutrient conditions.
